bibl.title: Military Orders for Albert E. Truby, May 3, 1899

div1.p: Truby is appointed to a general court-martial.

div1.head: Military Orders for Albert E. Truby, May 3, 1899
div1.p:
1. First Lieutenant Albert E. Truby, Assistant Surgeon,
U.S.A., is detailed as a member of the General Court-
Martial convened by paragraph 2, Special Orders No. 102,
c. s., these Headquarters, for the trial of Privates Charles
R. Fowler, John J. Byrnes and John M. Lynch, Battery L.
2nd Artillery.

2. Private Thomas Kelly, Company L, 8th Infantry, will
report to the Adjutant General, Department of Havana,
for duty as orderly.

3. Battery B, 2nd Artillery, will move from the Maes-
tranza de Artillería to Cabaña tomorrow morning, May
4th, 1899.

4. The Commanding Officer, 8th Infantry, will cause one
of his companies to be ready to move into the Maestranza
de Artillería on the morning of May 4th, to take the place
of Battery B, 2nd Artillery, going to Cabaña. The Com-
manding Officer of the company designated will take charge
of the 160 soldiers from outside departments, quartered in
the Maestranza, who are to go north on the “Havana”
Saturday, May 6th, for discharge.
div1.closer:
BY COMMAND OF BRIGADIER-GENERAL LUDLOW: H. L. SCOTT,
Adjutant General. OFFICIAL:
B.H. Merchant
1st Lieutenant 8th Infantry
Aide-de-Camp.
